questions.questionText: Good planning and design, while crucial for every type of training program, are even more important for e-learning projects. State true or false.

answers.answerText: True
answers.Feedback: The statement is indeed true! In traditional classroom training, the largest effort goes into delivering of training sessions, while in e-learning, it is in the design and development of the materials. Well planned and designed e-learning is self-contained and can often be used multiple times without making ongoing adjustments.

answers.answerText: False
answers.Feedback: The statement is actually true! In traditional classroom training, the largest effort goes into delivering of training sessions, while in e-learning, it is in the design and development of the materials. Well planned and designed e-learning is self-contained and can often be used multiple times without making ongoing adjustments.

questions.questionText: The 'ADDIE' model is a framework for developing effective training material. What does the A in ADDIE stand for?

answers.answerText: Analysis
answers.Feedback: That is correct! Analysis is the first stage of the ADDIE process, the other stages being Design, Development, Implementation and Evaluation. Analyzing the learning needs and content is essential to ensure learners’ motivation and participation.

questions.questionText: If an individual is unable to perform well at their job, then training or other learning activities are the only solution. State true or false.

answers.answerText: True
answers.Feedback: The statement is actually false! Training may not always be the only solution. Performance problems can also result from environmental factors, such as bad data, outdated tools or poor incentives

answers.answerText: False
answers.Feedback: The statement is indeed false! Training may not always be the only solution. Performance problems can also result from environmental factors, such as bad data, outdated tools or poor incentives.

questions.questionText: You have identified a specific performance gap you believe can be addressed with an e-learning course. What should you do next?

answers.answerText: Arm the target audience with as much information as possible
answers.Feedback: That is incorrect! The likelihood of developing an effective e‑learning course increases when more relevant information is collected on learners.

answers.answerText: Assess what the target audience must learn in order to close that gap
answers.Feedback: That is correct! The likelihood of developing an effective e‑learning course increases when more relevant information is collected on learners.

questions.questionText: Adult learners differ from student learners in some respects, which can influence the design of learning programs. Which one of the following is NOT a characteristic of adult learners?

answers.answerText: They need to know why they have to learn something
answers.Feedback: That is incorrect! Adult learners actually prefer to approach learning with a problem solving mindset. Also, most adult learners prefer to study at a time, place and pace convenient for them.

answers.answerText: They like to learn experientially
answers.Feedback: That is incorrect! Adult learners actually prefer to approach learning with a problem solving mindset. Also, most adult learners prefer to study at a time, place and pace convenient for them.

answers.answerText: They do not prefer a problem-solving approach to learning
answers.Feedback: That is correct! Adult learners actually prefer to approach learning with a problem solving mindset. Also, most adult learners prefer to study at a time, place and pace convenient for them.

answers.answerText: They learn better where they can see the immediate value and application of content
answers.Feedback: That is incorrect! Adult learners actually prefer to approach learning with a problem solving mindset. Also, most adult learners prefer to study at a time, place and pace convenient for them.

questions.questionText: Which type of skills can be developed using e-learning?

answers.answerText: Cognitive skills only, which include knowledge and comprehension, procedural skills and problem solving
answers.Feedback: Not quite! Most e-learning courses are developed to build cognitive skills; however, learning in the interpersonal domain can also be addressed in e-learning by using specific methods like interactive role playing with appropriate feedback.

answers.answerText: Cognitive skills and some interpersonal skills such as active listening, presenting, negotiating, etc.
answers.Feedback: That is correct! Most e-learning courses are developed to build cognitive skills; however, learning in the interpersonal domain can also be addressed in e-learning by using specific methods like interactive role playing with appropriate feedback.

answers.answerText: Some interpersonal skills only
answers.Feedback: Not quite! Most e-learning courses are developed to build cognitive skills; however, learning in the interpersonal domain can also be addressed in e-learning by using specific methods like interactive role playing with appropriate feedback.

answers.answerText: Every skill under the sun including psychomotor skills such as learning a sport or driving a car
answers.Feedback: Not quite! Most e-learning courses are developed to build cognitive skills; however, learning in the interpersonal domain can also be addressed in e-learning by using specific methods like interactive role playing with appropriate feedback.

questions.questionText: When a course is job-oriented, conducting a task analysis is a good way to ensure that you are including relevant content. State true or false.

answers.answerText: True
answers.Feedback: The statement is indeed true! A detailed analysis of actions and decisions that a person takes to perform their job task will help you to identify the knowledge and skills that you will need to support with training.

answers.answerText: False
answers.Feedback: The statement is actually true! A detailed analysis of actions and decisions that a person takes to perform their job task will help you to identify the knowledge and skills that you will need to support with training.

questions.questionText: Learning objectives describe behaviors that learners should exhibit as a result of participating in the course. Well-written learning objectives should include all of the following except:

answers.answerText: An estimate of cost
answers.Feedback: That is correct! Ideally, learning objectives should include a description of a desired behavior or competency, the condition under which the learner is expected to perform and the criteria for acceptable performance. Additionally, it is important that the course objectives are relevant for the learners and meet their existing needs.

answers.answerText: Desired behavior
answers.Feedback: That is incorrect! questions.questionText: Which of the following are benefits of writing clear learning objectives during the planning process of your course? Select all that apply.

answers.answerText: Gives the learners a clear idea of what to expect to learn and what is expected of them after the course
answers.Feedback: That is correct! For maximum effectiveness, make sure the learning objectives for your course are Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Realistic and Time-bound (SMART).

answers.answerText: Gives the instructional designer a goal to achieve in presenting the content of the course
answers.Feedback: That is correct! For maximum effectiveness, make sure the learning objectives for your course are Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Realistic and Time-bound (SMART).

answers.answerText: Forms the basis for evaluating the learners and effectiveness of the course
answers.Feedback: That is correct! For maximum effectiveness, make sure the learning objectives for your course are Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Realistic and Time-bound (SMART).

answers.answerText: Informs the learner where to find answers to the quiz questions
answers.Feedback: Not quite! The correct options are marked. For maximum effectiveness, make sure the learning objectives for your course are Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Realistic and Time-bound (SMART).
